discussion.content:
They are:
- Dynamic Desirable
- Dynamic Auto
- Trunk

questions.question_text: What are the possible trunking modes for a switch port? (Choose three.)

Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

The network administrator cannot connect to Switch 1 over a Telnet session, although the hosts attached to Switch1 can ping the interface Fa0/0 of the router.
Given the information in the graphic and assuming that the router and Switch2 are configured properly, which of the following commands should be issued on
Switch1 to correct this problem?

choices.B: Switch1(config)# interface fa0/1 Switch1(config-if)# switchport mode trunk
choices.E: Switch1(config)# interface fa0/1 Switch1(config-if)# duplex full Switch1(confiq-if)# speed 100
choices.C: Switch1(config)# line con0 Switch1(config-line)# password cisco Switch1(config-line)# login
choices.D: Switch1(config)# interface fa0/1 Switch1(config-if)# ip address 192.168.24.3 255.255.255.0

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Switch1(config)# ip default-gateway 192.168.24.1

questions.question_text: Which two steps must you perform on each device that is configured for IPv4 routing before you implement OSPFv3? (Choose two)

discussion.content:
Correct is DE

Before you enable OSPF for IPv6 on an interface, you must perform the following:
+ Complete the OSPF network strategy and planning for your IPv6 network. For example, you must decide whether multiple areas are required.
+ Enable IPv6 unicast routing.
+ Enable IPv6 on the interface.

Reference: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/ip-version-6-ipv6/112100-ospfv3-config-guide.html

Note: If we have already had an active interface, we donâ€™t need to configure the router ID for OSPFv3 anymore because the device will automatically choose that IPv4 address for its router ID).

D and E,
 because the question say : " the device was configured for ipv4 befor you implement ospfv3 ", so yu dont need a RID

choices.B: in Most cases, they are physically connected to other network devices to provide network connectivity
choices.C: They can protect a network from internal and external threats.
choices.A: They can provide access within enterprises and to the public.
choices.D: Most access points provide Wi-Fi and Bluetooth connectivity.
choices.E: They must be hardwired to a modem.

discussion.content: The correct answer should be A and B. I don't think access points provide Bluetooth

questions.question_text: Which two statements about access points are true? (Choose two)

choices.E: It is used for a 6to4 tunnel
choices.B: It is used for an ISATAP tunnel
choices.C: The embedded IPv4 address is an RFC 1918 address
choices.A: The embedded IPv4 address can be globally routed.
choices.D: The MAC address 20:02:b0:10:be:ef is embedded into the IPv6 address
